14
15#ifndef ISC_INTERFACEITER_H
16#define ISC_INTERFACEITER_H 1
17
18/*****
19 ***** Module Info
20 *****/
21
22/*! \file isc/interfaceiter.h
23 * \brief Iterates over the list of network interfaces.
24 *
25 * Interfaces whose address family is not supported are ignored and never
26 * returned by the iterator. Interfaces whose netmask, interface flags,
27 * or similar cannot be obtained are also ignored, and the failure is logged.
28 *
29 * Standards:
30 * The API for scanning varies greatly among operating systems.
31 * This module attempts to hide the differences.
32 */
33
34/***
35 *** Imports
36 ***/
37
38#include <inttypes.h>
39
40#include <isc/lang.h>
41#include <isc/netaddr.h>
42#include <isc/types.h>
43
44/*!
45 * \brief Public structure describing a network interface.
46 */
47
48struct isc_interface {
49 char name[32]; /*%< Interface name, null-terminated. */
50 unsigned int af; /*%< Address family. */
51 isc_netaddr_t address; /*%< Local address. */
52 isc_netaddr_t netmask; /*%< Network mask. */
53 isc_netaddr_t dstaddress; /*%< Destination address (point-to-point only). */
54 uint32_t flags; /*%< Flags; see INTERFACE flags. */
55};
56
57/*@{*/
58/*! Interface flags. */
59
60#define INTERFACE_F_UP 0x00000001U
61#define INTERFACE_F_POINTTOPOINT 0x00000002U
62#define INTERFACE_F_LOOPBACK 0x00000004U
63/*@}*/
64
65/***
66 *** Functions
67 ***/
68
69ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
70
71isc_result_t
72isc_interfaceiter_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_interfaceiter_t **iterp);
73/*!<
74 * \brief Create an iterator for traversing the operating system's list
75 * of network interfaces.
76 *
77 * Returns:
78 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
79 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
80 *\li Various network-related errors
81 */
82
83isc_result_t
84isc_interfaceiter_first(isc_interfaceiter_t *iter);
85/*!<
86 * \brief Position the iterator on the first interface.
87 *
88 * Returns:
89 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS Success.
90 *\li #ISC_R_NOMORE There are no interfaces.
91 */
92
93isc_result_t
94isc_interfaceiter_current(isc_interfaceiter_t *iter,
95 isc_interface_t *ifdata);
96/*!<
97 * \brief Get information about the interface the iterator is currently
98 * positioned at and store it at *ifdata.
99 *
100 * Requires:
101 *\li The iterator has been successfully positioned using
102 * isc_interface_iter_first() / isc_interface_iter_next().
103 *
104 * Returns:
105 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS Success.
106 */
107
108isc_result_t
109isc_interfaceiter_next(isc_interfaceiter_t *iter);
110/*!<
111 * \brief Position the iterator on the next interface.
112 *
113 * Requires:
114 * \li The iterator has been successfully positioned using
115 * isc_interface_iter_first() / isc_interface_iter_next().
116 *
117 * Returns:
118 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS Success.
119 *\li #ISC_R_NOMORE There are no more interfaces.
120 */
121
122void
123isc_interfaceiter_destroy(isc_interfaceiter_t **iterp);
124/*!<
125 * \brief Destroy the iterator.
126 */
127
128ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
129
130#endif /* ISC_INTERFACEITER_H */
131
